original: DYMLING, Carl Anders Fil. !Lic., Stockholm, f Gbg 26/3 98 av avd.ch Ch D o Martha Levgren, gm Greta Westberg. Studex 16, fil kand 21, fil lic 25. Aman Gbg Stadsbibl 23—27, progr.ch Radiotj Gbg 26—30, avd.ch Radiotj Sthlm 30, ch f radioteatern 31—35, riksprogr.-ch o vkst dir Radiotj 36, vkst dir Sv Filmind 42. Led Stat Inf.styr 40—42, led Filmutredn 41—42. Resor: I de fi europ länd samt USA 36, Egypt, Palestina o Syrien 38. Av trycket: Litt.hist upps, litt.krit art o rec i tidn o tidskr, medarb Sv biogr lexikon o Sv uppslagsbok mm, utg Radiotjänst, en bok om programmet o lyssnarna (tills m J Rabe 29), Röster om Radio 34. RVO, RFinlVRO, RNO, TjeckVLO, RDDO, medl Rotary. °DYMI,ING, Olof Richard, Direktör, Stockholm, f Härnösand 25/5 98, gm Erna Fähn-rich-Frandsen. Studex Djursholm 17, resoffex 19, studier i Frankr, Engl o USA 20—24. Del-äg i Fma Jacob Versteegh, Hsand o Sthlm, sed. 28.
translated:
DYMLING, Carl Anders, Son of Ch D and Martha Levgren, born in Gothenburg on 26th March 1898. Married to Greta Westberg. Graduated in 1916, Bachelor of Arts in 1921, Licentiate in 1925. Employed at Gothenburg City Library from 1923 to 1927, Programme Chief at Gothenburg Radio from 1926 to 1930, Department Chief at Stockholm Radio from 1930, Director of Radio Theatre from 1931 to 1935, Director of Programme Development and Growth at Radio from 1936, Director of Growth at Swedish Film Industry from 1942. Member of the State Information Board from 1940 to 1942, Member of the Film Investigation Board from 1941 to 1942. Travelled to various European countries and the USA in 1936, Egypt, Palestine, and Syria in 1938. Published in historical research, literary criticism articles, and reviews in newspapers and magazines, contributor to Swedish Biography Lexicon and Swedish Encyclopedia, among others. Published a book about the program and listenership of Radio (with J Rabe in 1929), Voices about Radio in 1934. Received the Royal Order of Vasa, the Finnish Order of the White Rose, the Norwegian Order of St. Olav, the Czech Order of the White Lion, and the Danish Order of the Dannebrog. Member of the Rotary Club.

DYMLING, Olof Richard, Director, born in Härnösand on 25th May 1898, married to Erna Fähnrich-Frandsen. Graduated from Djursholm in 1917, Reserve Officer's exam in 1919, studied in France, England, and the USA from 1920 to 1924. Co-owner of Fma Jacob Versteegh, Härnösand, and Stockholm since 1928.
